io.github.actorish4j

Class StateMachine<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.actorish4j.StateMachine<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - event type

    public abstract class StateMachine<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    Event-Driven State Machine implementation inspired by Erlang gen_statem (gen_fsm) behaviour in a "state functions mode".

    gen_statem Behavior

    "State functions mode" means that each state has StateMachine.StateFunc, which handles events.

    This class provides various transition methods forms : goTo(...) including forms with timeouts and async transitions.

    There're two predefined states that can be used with goTo: sameState() and finalState()

    To create a state machine, the user must inherit from this class, implement initialState() method and override send(Object) to be public or better provide your own specific sending methods which call send() internally.

    In its final state StateMachine will just keep logging (debug level) events forever, this can be customized Conf#setFinalStateHandler(EventConsumer)

    Be careful, if StateFunc throws an uncaught exception then StateMachine will go to finalState() automatically, this is also customizable, see: recover(Throwable)

    Clients can be notified when the final state was reached finalStateReached() and determine the cause of it
